proposal.additionalInfo: \x - \xhh is equivalent to 0xhh
\u - \uhhhh is equivalent to 0xhhhh
. - may or may not match line terminators depending on flags (you can set DOTALL mode using ?s)
\s - [ \t\n\x0B\f\r]
\w - [a-zA-Z_0-9], i.e. a standard character, an underscore or a digit
^ - The beginning of a line
$ - The end of a line
\b - The beginning of a Word (a region consisting of Word-characters, [a-zA-Z_0-9])

proposal.displayString: Not a word beginning or end
proposal.additionalInfo: \B - Neither the beginning nor the end of a Word (a region consisting of Word-characters, [a-zA-Z_0-9])
\A - Start of input
\Z - The end of the input (apart from a possible terminator)
\z - The end of the input

? - match the preceeding expression 0 or 1 times.
Greedy: reads the whole input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) backs off by one character and tries again.

* - match the preceeding expression 0 or more times.
Greedy: reads the whole input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) backs off by one character and tries again.

+ - match the preceeding expression 1 or more times.
Greedy: reads the whole input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) backs off by one character and tries again.

{n} - match the preceeding expression exactly n times.
Greedy: reads the whole input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) backs off by one character and tries again.

{n,} - match the preceeding expression at least n times.
Greedy: reads the whole input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) backs off by one character and tries again.

proposal.displayString: Greedy match >= n times but <= m times
proposal.additionalInfo:
{n,m} - match the preceeding expression at least n and at most m times.
Greedy: reads the whole input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) backs off by one character and tries again.

?? - match the preceeding expression 0 or 1 times.
Reluctant: reads the first character of the input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) reads one additional character and tries again.

proposal.displayString: Match 0 or more times (left to right)
proposal.additionalInfo:
*? - match the preceeding expression 0 or more times.
Reluctant: reads the first character of the input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) reads one additional character and tries again.

proposal.displayString: Match 1 or more times (left to right)
proposal.additionalInfo:
+? - match the preceeding expression 1 or more times.
Reluctant: reads the first character of the input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) reads one additional character and tries again.

proposal.displayString: Match exactly n times (left to right)
proposal.additionalInfo:
{n}? - match the preceeding expression exactly n times.
Reluctant: reads the first character of the input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) reads one additional character and tries again.

{n,}? - match the preceeding expression at least n times.
Reluctant: reads the first character of the input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) reads one additional character and tries again.

proposal.displayString: Match >= n times but <= m times (left to right)
proposal.additionalInfo:
{n,m}? - match the preceeding expression at least n and at most m times.
Reluctant: reads the first character of the input, tries to match and then (repeatedly) reads one additional character and tries again.
U|V - either the expresion to the left or the expression to the right of the bar.

proposal.displayString: Mark U as a named capturing group
Match of the named capturing group
proposal.additionalInfo: {\Groupname} - Matches the capturing-group defined with the name 'Groupname'

proposal.displayString: Match of the capturing group i
proposal.additionalInfo: \i - matches the capturing group # i
\ - Escape for special characters (e.g. \\ matches a Backslash)
Example: [ecq] - e, c or q
Example: [^ecq] - neither e nor c nor q
Example: [e-q] - either character in the ASCII-range between e and q (inclusive)
\p{InGreek} - a character in the Greek block [\x0370-\x03FF]
\P{InGreek} - a character not in the Greek block [^\x0370-\x03FF]
\p{InU} - a character in the block U (block names are defined in http://www.unicode.org/Public/3.0-Update/Blocks-3.txt, Spaces removed such that 'Basic Latin' is to be used as \p{InBasicLatin} etc.)

\P{InU} - a character not in the block U (block names are defined in http://www.unicode.org/Public/3.0-Update/Blocks-3.txt, Spaces removed such that 'Basic Latin' is to be used as \p{InBasicLatin} etc.)
\p{Lu} - Example for a Unicode category: Uppercase letter
\p{Sc} - Example for a Unicode category: Currency symbol
(?:U) - Define U as a non-capturing group

proposal.displayString: Turn on flag (i, m, s, x, u, or X)
proposal.additionalInfo: (?imsxuX) - Turn on a flag (i: Case-insensitive matching, m: Multiline mode, s: Dot matches all, x: ignore whitespace, u:treat \w, \d, \s, etc. as relating to Unicode, X: Enables compatibility with XML schema regular expressions.)

proposal.displayString: Turn off flag (i, m, s, x, u, or X)
proposal.additionalInfo: (?-imsxuX) - Turn off a flag (i: Case-insensitive matching, m: Multiline mode, s: Dot matches all, x: ignore whitespace, u:treat \w, \d, \s, etc. as relating to Unicode, X: Enables compatibility with XML schema regular expressions.)

proposal.displayString: Turn on flag in group (i, m, s, x, u, or X)
proposal.additionalInfo: (?imsxuX:U) - Turn on a flag in the group enclosed by brackets (not a capturing group!) (i: Case-insensitive matching, m: Multiline mode, s: Dot matches all, x: ignore whitespace, u:treat \w, \d, \s, etc. as relating to Unicode, X: Enables compatibility with XML schema regular expressions.)

proposal.displayString: Turn off flag in group (i, m, s, x, u, or X)
proposal.additionalInfo: (?-imsxuX:U) - Turn off a flag in the group enclosed by brackets (not a capturing group!) (i: Case-insensitive matching, m: Multiline mode, s: Dot matches all, x: ignore whitespace, u:treat \w, \d, \s, etc. as relating to Unicode, X: Enables compatibility with XML schema regular expressions.)
